**Interactions of Clethodim and Dicamba on Glyphosate-resistant Volunteer Corn Control**

"Vitor Muller Anunciato; Gabrielle de Castro Macedo; Daniel Araujo Doretto; Jeff A. Golus ; Caio A. Carbonari; Greg R. Kruger."

---
## Introduction

+ Common weed escape in soybean fields in Midwest and Mid-South.

+ Can reduce soybean yield through competition, cause problems with harvest,
host insects and diseases, and contaminate soybean seeds at the harvest.

+ Clethodim is known for its good grass control in post-emergence applications

+ However, antagonistic interactions have been reported when applied in tank-mixtures.

+ There is limited information on the efficacy of this tank-mixture on GRVC control.
---
## Objectives
â€¢ To evaluate the effects of this tank-mixture on GRVC control (F1 generation)
at different heights, with and without the use of non-ionic surfactant (NIS).

---
## Field Trial
+ Field planted at Dryland Farm. 25,000 seeds/acre (62,500 seeds/ha)

+ Plants heights: 12 in (30 cm), 24 in (60 cm) and 36 in (90 cm)

+ Split in plots with 10 x 30 ft each (3 x 10 m)

+ TTI 11002. 15 GPA (140 L/ha), 40 psi (276 KPa), 3.9 mph (6.3 km/h)

---
## Treatments
.pull-left[
**No R11 (NIS) in mixture 0.25% v/v**

**1.** Clethodim 76 g.i.a./ha

**2.** Clethodim 102 g.i.a./ha

**3.** Clethodim  136 g.i.a./ha

**4.** Clethodim 9 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**5.** Clethodim 12 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**6.** Clethodim 16 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**7.** Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha]

.pull-right[
**With R11 (NIS) in mixture 0.25% v/v**

**1.** Clethodim 76 g.i.a./ha

**2.** Clethodim 102 g.i.a./ha

**3.** Clethodim  136 g.i.a./ha

**4.** Clethodim 9 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**5.** Clethodim 12 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**6.** Clethodim 16 fl oz/a + Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha

**7.** Dicamba 560 g a.e./ha]

+ All solutions with Intact at 0.5% v/v
